lessonSubtitleText: Test how well you know this story

questions.question: What did the Israelites do to make God angry?
answers: They complained about manna and wanted the food they had in Egypt
They refused to gather manna at all
They built another golden calf
They tried to return to Mount Sinai

questions.question: When the people complained about the manna, what did God say?
answers: I will give you meat until you hate it
You will only eat manna forever
You will have no food at all
Go find your own food

questions.question: What meat did God send?
answers: God covered the ground with quail
God filled the rivers with fish
God sent in an army of cows
God sent chicken from the sky

questions.question: What happened as they ate the quail?
answers: Many people died of a plague
They gained super powers
The quail tasted bad
They apologized for complaining

questions.question: When the Israelites complained about water, what did God tell Moses to do?
answers: Speak to a rock, and water would come out
Strike the rock twice
Dig a well with the people
Wait for rain to fall

questions.question: How did Moses disobey God?
answers: He dishonored God, yelled at the people, and struck the rock
He bowed down to the rock
He kicked the rock
He asked Aaron to speak instead

questions.question: What consequence did God give to Moses and Aaron for their sin?
answers: They could not enter the Promised Land
They became bald
They had to return to Egypt
They were removed from the camp

questions.question: When the people complained again, what did God send to punish them?
answers: Venomous snakes
A swarm of flies
A sandstorm
Wild lions

questions.question: What did God tell Moses to do to save the people who were bitten by snakes?
answers: Put a bronze snake on a pole; those who look at it would live
Give them special medicine made from manna
Pray over each person one at a time
Dip them in the river

questions.question: How did the bronze snake point to Jesus?
answers: He was lifted up on the cross; those who believe in Him are saved
He turned snakes into bread
He saved people from snakebites
He carried a staff like Moses
